text:
Krakow Airport Opens New Passenger Terminal Building and Train Station  
Jet2.com customers flying to Krakow are set to enjoy an even higher level of service after Krakow Airport officially opened the first part of its new passenger terminal building, as well as a new airport train station with a direct connection to the city centre. The work forms part of a major investment project concerning the extension and modernisation of the airport that will be capable of serving 8 million passengers annually.
 
Jan Pamuła, Krakow Airport President, said: “We can easily say that we have built a new airport…passengers are provided with a much higher level of service and comfortable conditions.”
 
The new rail link will run 31 trains per day every 30 minutes in each direction between Kraków Airport and Wieliczka Rynek-Kopalnia. The maximum speed on the line has been doubled to 80 km/h, meaning passengers can travel between the airport and city centre in just 18 minutes.
 
In addition to its current flights from Newcastle to Krakow, Jet2.com and Jet2CityBreaks recently unveiled the addition of Krakow as a new route from Manchester Airport. The twice weekly flights will commence on 28th April 2016.
 
A firm favourite with a whole range of visitors, from couples, families and friends, to hen and stag parties, Poland’s second biggest city benefits from high temperatures throughout the summer, booming nightlife and a rich cultural heritage – it’s stunning Old Town was one of the first UNESCO World Heritage sites.
 
Source:- Jet2.com
